pullRequest.body:
A bunch of simple lemmas for simple graphs.

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->
From LeanCamCombi

nodes.body: Note: I have pushed an update to the lean toolchain because this PR was on a [buggy version](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/113488-general/topic/Potential.20data.20loss.20from.20.60lake.20clean.60.20with.204.2E2.2E0-rc2.2F3/near/397875701) of the toolchain. **WARNING**: checking out old commits of this PR using v4.2.0-rc2 or v4.2.0-rc3 can cause `lake clean` to delete your mathlib folder! If you need to do so, make sure to delete `lakefile.olean` manually before running any `lake` commands.

Thanks :tada: 

If CI passes, please remove the label `awaiting-CI` and merge this yourself, by adding a comment `bors r+`.

bors d+

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

This should now have been fixed on master.

bors merge

Let's remove this test in a standalone PR

bors r-

Finally the time, hopefully!

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7079547769/job/19266308424)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7079547769/job/19266308149)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7079547769/job/19266308294)
These two lemmas seem to be in opposition to `disjoint_edgeSet` as simp lemmas. Do we want the normal form for `Disjoint` to be in terms of the graphs themselves or the edge sets?
I don't really mind which way the lemma goes, but one way should be simp.

We shouldn't have noncomputable Fintype instances -- anyone who needs one should introduce a local instance (for example from the `Finite` instance below).

If I'm not mistaken, `[DecidableRel G.Adj]` and `[DecidableRel H.Adj]` suffice to make this computable. You might need `[DecidableEq V]` too if you want to go through `Pi.Fintype` and filter the result.
Well technically there are cases where no computable fintype instance can be provided. But I guess this is not the case here.

In cases where we can't provide a computable fintype instance, I don't think we should provide a fintype instance at all (at best, we could have a non-instance `def`, or scoped instances). If we're willing to have non-computable Fintype instances, we may as well stop worrying about decidability and switch everything to Finite.
Isn't the letter after epsilon zeta, not nu?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: More simple simple graph lemmas
